overview: The purpose and intent of this measure is to appropriate moneys for housing programs. [14] More specifically, the measure appropriates moneys to the Office of the Governor for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program and to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the development of supportive housing projects. [14] The measure also provides for the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. [14]
appropriations: Governor Green’s Executive Biennium Budget requested $50 million (HB431_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_.PDF.txt) each year for Fiscal Years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [13] The Committee on Ways and Means has amended this measure by changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [14]
assumptions_and_methodology: The requested funding will help to achieve the Governor’s goal of establishing 30 kauhale villages across the state by the end of 2026. [13] This builds upon the current number of 18 currently established. [13]
agency_impact: The measure has been amended by changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [14] The Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation (HHFDC) requests $175,000 (HB431_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_.PDF.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I position to help administer the provisions in Section 5 of the bill. [13]
economic_impact: The Committee on Ways and Means has amended this measure by authorizing monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale. [14]
policy_impact: Your Committee has amended this measure by removing the preambles contained in sections 1 and 4 of the measure. [14] The measure now requires kauhale to be connected to public utilities. [14] It also changes the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [14]
revenue_sources: The primary source of funding is an appropriation out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [12] The measure has been amended to authorize monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale, creating a potential revenue stream. [14]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The Office of the Governor's Executive Biennium Budget requested $50 million (HB431_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_.PDF.txt) each year for Fiscal Years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 for the Kauhale Initiative. [13] This potential funding will help to continue to allow the Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions to continue its important work. [13] It will also help to achieve the Governor’s goal of establishing 30 kauhale villages across the state by the end of 2026. [13] The appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program has been changed from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [14]
operating_revenue_impact: The measure has been amended by authorizing monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale. [14] This will create an operating revenue stream for the program. [14]
capital_expenditure_impact: Your Committee has amended this measure by requiring kauhale to be connected to public utilities. [14] This requirement may impact capital expenditures for site development and construction. [14]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The Governor’s Executive Biennium Budget requested $50 million (HB431_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_.PDF.txt) each year for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027, indicating a significant ongoing fiscal need for the Kauhale program. [13] The newly authorized monthly rents for kauhale may partially offset long-term operating costs. [14]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The Committee on Ways and Means has amended this measure with several changes. [14] [14] Additionally, the Office of the Governor provided a specific funding request of $50 million (HB431_SD1_TESTIMONY_WAM_03-28-25_.PDF.txt) each year for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027.
